material.mattext:
Now two charged particles are shown, once again with opposite charges. The next four questions refer to this same charge distribution, shown in 3D space with x, y, and z axes. In all questions, assume there are not other charged objects nearby, besides those shown.

What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.

Now two charged particles are shown, but now both are negatively charged. The next four questions refer to this same charge distribution, shown in 3D space with x, y, and z axes. In all questions, assume there are not other charged objects nearby, besides those shown.

What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.

The next three questions refer to the same arrangement of charged particles with 2D axes. Assume there are no other charged objects nearby, besides those shown.

What is the direction of the electric field at the point in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram? Select the best option.
No direction. at this location.

Note that the charge arrangement has changed. The next three questions refer to this new arrangement of charged particles with 2D axes.

What is the direction of the electric field at the point in the diagram. Assume there are no other charged objects nearby, besides those shown. Select the best option.
No direction. at this point.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram. Assume there are no other charged objects nearby, besides those shown. Select the best option.
No direction.
What is the direction of the electric field at the point  in the diagram. Assume there are no other charged objects nearby, besides those shown. Select the best option.
No direction.
